newsitem.title: USA: Fed adds reserves through two-day system.
newsitem.headline: Fed adds reserves through two-day system.

text.p: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York added temporary reserves to the banking system via two-day system repurchase agreements, a Fed spokesman said.

The move came as a surprise to many analysts who said they had expected the Fed to refrain from open market operations on Tuesday. But they said the add of reserves was a technical move and they saw no monetary policy implications.
At 1130 EDT/1530 GMT, the time when the fed usually intervenes in the market, federal funds rate stood at 5-3/16 percent, below the Fed's 5-1/4 percent target.
